H0.text: where does the city of paris get its name. Gallicus

H1.text: where does the city of paris get its name. Patricius

H2.text: where does the city of paris get its name. Parisis

H3.text: where does the city of paris get its name. Parisii

A4.text: The name Paris is derived from its early inhabitants, the Parisii, a Gallic tribe from the Iron Age and the Roman period.

A5.text: The ancient oppidum that corresponds to the modern city of Paris was first mentioned in the mid-1st century BC by Julius Caesar as Lutetia Parisiorum ('Lutetia of the Parisii') and is later attested as Parision in the 5th century AD, then as Paris in 1265.
